data.title: Heritage In Action
data.text:
Great place to visit - represents the past of the area with Indian, Spanish, American eras shown.

There are some guided tours here but timing was not understood. Call for more information.

Not completely ADA but walker and cane may help. Stairs used to see inside some buildings. Steps up and down in some other areas.

Entrance is is inside mini strip mall.

Worth your time is YES

data.title: A bit of Southern California history presented well.
data.text:
Heritage Hill Historic Park is a gem tucked away in Lake Forest worth visiting. There is an Adobe furnished with authentic period furniture that provides a glimpse into early California living. A short walk leads to a school house depicting early turn of the century education with appropriate furnishings. 

There are several events held at the park during the year. These events, complete with docent participation, highlight special times including Cheistmas celebrated in costume with singers and refreshments for visitors.

During the school year local schools bring students who participate in a class lead by docents in period costume to get a taste of what it was like in years gone by. Much has gone into accurate restoration of all the structures on the property and the cadre of volunteers should be applauded for their efforts.

data.title: Great local folklore and history
data.text:
This park has several buildings, home  and a church that were relocated from various locations in the area to thus park.  The docents and park put on several programs throughout the year including June Halloween, thanksgiving and Christmas.  Have been in the area for over 30 years and always a treat to drop in.  
Great for young families and grandkids!!!

data.title: Just beautiful!
data.text: This little gem is tucked away near a shopping center.  If you didn't know it was there you would miss it.  I attended a wedding there and it was just beautiful.  It is very secluded and feels so different once inside you forget that there is a shopping center right outside but because there is there is ample parking and lots of food options.

data.title: A surprise of historical history and culture so close to home
data.text: When you enter its like stepping back in time. This is a well maintained park atmosphere that includes many historical buildings and farming equipment. Each building or piece has a place card that gives relevant information and social application. This park incorporates different levels and offers different views . I was truly surprised such a gem existed in my neighborhood .

data.title: History
data.text: Enjoy the history and the fun things they do there. They have different events and family things as well.

data.title: A hidden Gem in South Orange County
data.text: The Heritage Hills Historical Park in Lake Forest is a great place to get an introduction into the are once known as El Toro. The park is open daily. Tuesday thru Sunday, 9 AM- 5 PM. There is a docent tour at 2 PM daily which is highly recommended as they open the buildings for your tour. This historical park includes the Serrano Adobe, St. George's Episcopal Mission, the one room El Toro Grammar School, and the Bennett Ranch House. The also have living history tours of school children. It is well worth a few hours to stroll the grounds, take the tour and view life as it was 120 years ago.

data.title: Learn Our Local Heritage!
data.text: Everyone who lives in our local Saddleback Valley should go to Heritage Hill Historic Park at least once.  All third-grade teachers should bring their classes on a field trip for their county curriculum.  The park has wonderful celebrations in May, October and December.  Kids and parents alike will have a blast!

data.title: Fun at Heritage Park
data.text: Fun place to celebrate Christmas cheer. I went to a wedding there. It was different and fun. I also painted a lovely watercolor painting.

data.title: church seniors outing
data.text: This park is the best kept secret in south Orange County. We had a city docent give us a personal tour of the one room school house and original church right off Serrano and Trabucco Road in Lake Forest . The cost. FREE.

data.title: Sweet and Special location for a wedding
data.text: Our son was recently married in the 1800s church on the property.  The reception was held "concert in the park" style near another historic building.  Beautiful and unique location for a smaller size wedding.

data.title: Small, Clean facility with Good Orange County History
data.text:
A group of friends and I visited the Heritage Hill Historic Park on a beautiful Southern California Winter Day.  The park is well maintained and the buildings are historically representative.  We took a tour guided by one of the docents.  It was very informative and conducted at a relaxed pace.  Lots of facts about the ancestral family and Orange County in general were provided.  If you want to see inside the buildings you have to take the tour which is free and well worth your time.   The tour is informal with people joining and dropping out all along the way.  So give it a try if you are not sure and have the time. 

The park is wheelchair and child friendly.  There are many picnic tables and the park hosts several special events (some with nominal charge) for schools and the general publlic.

data.title: My 8 year old enjoyed this visit!
data.text: I took my 8 year old on a docent tour here this past summer.  It was very interesting for us to see how people lived when they first arrived to the area.  The docent was very informative.  We got to see a school house, church, house and much more.  We really loved our visit and I loved that it snuck in some great education for my daughter as well!  By the way, the grounds are beautiful and stroller friendly, but I ended up taking the baby out of her stroller and leaving my stroller outside each building.  I think everyone in the area should visit at least once!

data.title: Very Interesting
data.text: We went for the Christmas celebration  but learned so much about the history of the area. This group of historical buildings are very interesting and beautiful. Great for family outings.

data.title: Nice historic park and interecting Docent
data.text: We have visited Heritage Hill Historic Park on numerous occasions and always find it interesting. We always go when the Docent will take a group out, and the information is voluminous. The historic buildings are well maintained and it is especially nice to walk around the park on a sunny day

data.title: Historic El Toro
data.text: This park, behind the Ralphs, and above the Serrano Creek Ranch Equestrian Center, houses several historic El Toro properties form early in the 20th century, and gives a great feel for what ranch life was once like in Orange County.

data.title: History of OC
data.text: You can visit this small park/historic site anytime but I recommended going Wednesday-Sunday at 11 or 2.At those times they have a guide that gives a tour. Not only do you get lots of interesting historical information; you also get better access to the buildings. Without a guide there are only certain things can look at the rest is locked.

data.title: Nice place close to home
data.text:
It is like going back
On time and so
Close to home, the only problem was to find the place, there Are not signs or much directions on how to get there; the city should do
A better job help with that !.

data.title: A bit of history
data.text: This is a collection of the original Serano's family adobe ,the original El-Toro one room school and few other structure from the early days of  pre commercialized Orange County. Ideal for a Sunday morning with small kids.

data.title: yes, this is about the only thing we have in Lake Forest Ca. with history
data.text: This is a very small park.  I would say if you are stopping in Lake Forest, you can certainly go take a look.  I doubt it will be a highlight of your day.  As it is in the back of a strip mall, it is easy access but not too enthralling.  You can devote an hour at most.  Let's face it Lake Forest is a GREAT place to live but not a destination:)
